comment: This lemma is used to prove that there exists x as in Lemma 1 of [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 90: 0 <= x(t) <= 1 for all t in T, x(t) < epsilon for all t in V, x(t) > 1 - epsilon for all t in T \ U. Here we prove the very last step of the proof of Lemma 1: "The result follows from taking x = 1 - q_n". Here ` E ` is used to represent ε in the paper, and ` y ` to represent q_n in the paper. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
